text:
Message 725 of 4024
Any movement would be factored in when we finalize division of assets. I would ask for stock transfer versus sale into cash and decide when I sell. If
you are insisting we do it now, I would suggest we split half of each stock interest, factoring in acquisition date.
We can work on plan for division of assets. We need to get financial declarations to lawyers with all the details of bank accounts. Investments, ccs,
assets etc
Sent:01/25/2024 at 08:12 AM
From:Christine Moyer
To:Robert Moyer (First Viewed: 01/25/2024 at 08:53 AM)
Subject:Re: Fidelity
Message 726 of 4024
Ok.
Confirming I have reached out to landlord to align and arrange timing for move out cleaning with twinkle and expectations.
I am not aware of any other action items to return apartment to landlord.
Sent:01/25/2024 at 08:46 AM
From:Christine Moyer
To:Robert Moyer (First Viewed: 01/25/2024 at 08:54 AM)
Subject:Re: Alki
Message 727 of 4024
At this time, I understand that:
- You have gone through my all personal items. You tried to hide that you had. We discussed over dim sum.
- I have zero say in any parenting decisions. You are asserting 100% legal custody and refuse all access to our kids.
Sent:01/25/2024 at 09:02 AM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 01/25/2024 at 09:31 AM)
Subject:Re: Packages / Items
Message 728 of 4024
I am not suggesting that. You are smart enough to know what I said. You’re insistence on misreading or acting like you do not understand the most
basic message and reply with a twisting of words is common but also tiring.
If you really struggle with what I am saying to you, it will save us a lot of cycles if you can have someone read my email and explain what it means. You
can also use popular AI tools that will assist in explaining your mother tongue.
Please consider options to save us both time. Till then, I’ll consider this conversation done. If you find a way to assist your reading comprehension, I’ll
be happy to discuss again.
Sent:01/25/2024 at 09:15 AM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 01/25/2024 at 09:32 AM)
Subject:Re: Fidelity
